Title: Percy Jackson and the Olympians
Plot: Demigod Percy Jackson leads a quest across America to prevent a war among the Olympian gods.

Title: Dickinson
Plot: Set in the 19th century, it explores the constraints of society, gender and family from the perspective of rebellious young poet, Emily Dickinson.

Title: Poor Things
Awards: Nominated for 11 Oscars. 93 wins & 408 nominations total
Plot: The incredible tale about the fantastical evolution of Bella Baxter, a young woman brought back to life by the brilliant and unorthodox scientist Dr. Godwin Baxter.

Title: Crush
Plot: An aspiring young artist joins her high school track team and later discovers what real love feels like when she finds herself falling for an unexpected teammate

Title: Mean Girls
Plot: Cady Heron is a hit with the Plastics, an A-list girl clique at her new school. But everything changes when she makes the mistake of falling for Aaron Samuels, the ex-boyfriend of alpha Plastic Regina George.

Title: Parasite
Plot: Greed and class discrimination threaten the newly formed symbiotic relationship between the wealthy Park family and the destitute Kim clan.

Title: Bottoms
Plot: Two unpopular queer high-school students start a fight club to have sex before graduation.

Title: Joker
Plot: During the 1980s, a failed stand-up comedian is driven insane and turns to a life of crime and chaos in Gotham City while becoming an infamous psychopathic crime figure.

Title: Stranger Things
Awards: Won 6 Primetime Emmys. 70 wins & 126 nominations total
Plot: When a young boy disappears, his mother, a police chief, and his friends must confront terrifying supernatural forces in order to get him back.

Title: Barbie
Plot: Barbie and Ken are having the time of their lives in the colorful and seemingly perfect world of Barbie Land. However, when they get a chance to go to the real world, they soon discover the joys and perils of living among humans.

Title: The Office
Awards: Won 5 Primetime Emmys. 51 wins & 195 nominations total
Director: Greg Daniels, Ricky Gervais, Stephen Merchant
Plot: A mockumentary on a group of typical office workers, where the workday consists of ego clashes, inappropriate behavior, and tedium.

Title: Orphan Black
Awards: Won 1 Primetime Emmy. 69 wins & 96 nominations total
Director: Kim Coghill, Andrew De Angelis, Jeff Detsky
Plot: A streetwise hustler is pulled into a compelling conspiracy after witnessing the suicide of a girl who looks just like her.

Title: Killing Eve
Awards: Won 1 Primetime Emmy. 43 wins & 168 nominations total
Plot: After a series of events, the lives of a security operative and an assassin become inextricably linked.

Title: The Last of Us
Awards: Won 8 Primetime Emmys. 55 wins & 132 nominations total
Plot: Twenty years after modern civilization has been destroyed, Joel, a hardened survivor, is hired to smuggle Ellie, a 14-year-old girl, out of an oppressive quarantine zone. What starts as a small job soon becomes a brutal, heartbreaking journey, as they both must traverse the U.S. and depend on each other for survival.

Title: Crash Landing on You
Plot: The absolute top secret love story of a chaebol heiress who made an emergency landing in North Korea because of a paragliding accident and a North Korean special officer who falls in love with her and who is hiding and protecting ...

Title: Loki
Awards: Nominated for 6 Primetime Emmys. 12 wins & 74 nominations total
Plot: The mercurial villain Loki resumes his role as the God of Mischief in a new series that takes place after the events of “Avengers: Endgame.

Title: Wednesday
Awards: Won 4 Primetime Emmys. 21 wins & 55 nominations total
Plot: Follows Wednesday Addams' years as a student, when she attempts to master her emerging psychic ability, thwart a killing spree, and solve the mystery that embroiled her parents.

Title: Blue Beetle
Plot: An alien scarab chooses Jaime Reyes to be its symbiotic host, bestowing the recent college graduate with a suit of armor that's capable of extraordinary powers, forever changing his destiny as he becomes the superhero known as Blu...

Title: Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse
Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. 99 wins & 158 nominations total
Director: Joaquim Dos Santos, Kemp Powers, Justin K. Thompson
Plot: Miles Morales catapults across the multiverse, where he encounters a team of Spider-People charged with protecting its very existence. When the heroes clash on how to handle a new threat, Miles must redefine what it means to be a ...

Title: Soul
Plot: Joe is a middle-school band teacher whose life hasn't quite gone the way he expected. His true passion is jazz. But when he travels to another realm to help someone find their passion, he soon discovers what it means to have soul.
